p: Replacing fish oil with rapeseed oil in diets of Atlantic salmon ( Salmo salar) on tissue lipid composition showed no effect on growth performance or feed efficiency [ 13]. However, high lipid levels occurred in the liver in fish fed 100% rapeseed oil, and replacement at 50% or higher significantly reduced levels of 20:5ω3, 22:6ω3, and the ratio of ω3 to ω6 in the muscle making it less beneficial for humans.
